intro: Caucasalia, commonly known as the Caucasian bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, including parts of Georgia, Russia, and Turkey. The plants typically feature showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, often with white or yellow markings. They are herbaceous perennials that thrive in cool, moist environments and are often found in meadows and forest edges. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
